body:
I tried in 0.20.5, and got the same problem.
DB:MySQL
there is a column ``count(1) as cnt`` and it displayed like ``2.00``
@bkyryliuk @mistercrunch: Any followup available?  Was this issue addressed?

I was looking at the data sent by the server - it sends in epochs (as I would expect). 
The client (javascript) changes this to UTC - can someone ( @xrmx ) kindly point me to instructions on how to run a "dev" version of superset locally , so that I can fix the issue in JS to add a setting to render this in the local timezone of the user viewing it ?

We are not having a lot of luck with request going to the celery cluster. we used this in the superset_config for both the webserver cluster and the worker (celery) cluster.  Does this look correct. 
```
class CeleryConfig(object):
  BROKER_URL = 'redis://xyz.cache.amazonaws.comcache.amazonaws.com:6379/0'
  CELERY_IMPORTS = ('superset.sql_lab', )
  CELERY_RESULT_BACKEND = 'redis://xyz.cache.amazonaws.com.cache.amazonaws.com:6379/0'
  CELERY_ANNOTATIONS = {'tasks.add': {'rate_limit': '10/s'}}
CELERY_CONFIG = CeleryConfig

from werkzeug.contrib.cache import RedisCache
RESULTS_BACKEND = RedisCache(
    host='xyz.cache.amazonaws.com', port=6379, key_prefix='superset_results')

```

![apply_filter](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27990562/33245851-4c948aac-d2c2-11e7-8531-749ac40d3f9b.gif)
 
Hi Max, thanks for adding 'Edit Mode'. I have a question, please see the attached example:
User has a dashboard with a filter-box, which can apply filter to all slices. If they changed filter, they can also saveas/overwrite the dashboard with changed filter value. 
So In this use case, applying filter and save dashboard with different filter value, is it to be in a `edit mode`?
I'm experiencing the same issue

Right, we need to allow for "Save As" in view mode. I had missed that. Let me add it back.

Note that changing the filter does not trigger the "has changed" notification.
Did you set your database as "Allow Async"?
Check out the CONTRIBUTING.md file in the repo.

Wait @niks-git, looks like you're trying to use Redshift as the metadata database for Superset. This won't work as Redshift is not a proper OLTP database. Redshift should be used as a database you query, not as a metadata backend for the app.

It's provided by Flask Appbuilder.
http://flask-appbuilder.readthedocs.io/en/latest/security.html#supported-authentication-types

Hi,

I'm triyng to get working superset as a subfolder of a virtual host:

http://my.server.com/superset/

Been unable so far. Is the previous config suitable to achieve this? If i replace YOUR_PREFIX for superset I end up in an endless loop:

`"rewrite or internal redirection cycle while internally redirecting to /superset//superset//..."`

Thank you.
@xrmx do you have an update on this? this would be a super useful fix.
LGTM
OK,I will have a try next time, thank you!
@geekSnails +1
Same with Max and Min metrics for each dimension- they would not make sense if the data is aggregated.
This https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/3920 should fix issue with dimension spec.
@graceguo-supercat I addressed your comment
related https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/3690
fixes https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/3943

I don't think that this is an issue. If my memory is right I think originally people at yahoo contributed the connector registry so that they could import connectors that are only relevant to them internally. You can imagine that they have some 3rd connector on their internal fork.

The `COUNT(*)` is not completely irrelevant and is a decent fallback default metric. I don't think we can assume that there will always be a `count` field to sum up either though.

I agree that users should be able to define a default metric other than `COUNT(*)`. That applies to both SQLAlchemy and Druid.

@mistercrunch It looks good to me. Only 1 question to clarify: all of the components' `editMode` default value is `false`, but dashboard's initial state is set `editMode` be true. is it an intended design? thank you.
@graceguo-supercat good point, I meant to set `editMode`'s default to `false` everywehre, let me fix that.
Thanks for fixing this. My only nit would be consistent number of blank lines, otherwise LGTM.

I just pulled in this change and found that if you don't have a dimension in the group by, it will throw an exception.

which database is this?

mssql
Your connection string to postgres is wrong, please close.
I have followed @JazzChen solution (except commenting in hive.py) and works perfect for me, thanks!
ok, i was thinking in a python virtual environment superset would create a new db. guess not.

I see the last check-in changed the config.py file so now postgres db setting is the active one. Do you really want this to be the case?

https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/commit/268edcfedd0eae0dcb33bdd1e14795f602ab4532#diff-21213919e9d7699522fc8d0fcabdc63f

@ayush0793 when you ran the 'superset db upgrade' command was an error thrown? If so you paste the stack trace. 

Also could you paste the SQLite schema for the columns table? In addition to the unit tests, when testing this change I successfully was able to upgrade an existing populated SQLite database.
Third's a charm hopefully
@john-bodley There is no error when 'superset db upgrade' is executed. Please try accessing druid datasources and open the explore druid window in both versions using same superset.db file.
thanks
Already opened a PR two hours ago :) https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/3955
LGTM
@vnnw yes this would be a good addition to get people up and going a little more easily.
LGTM

Side note: I've been thinking that we could parameterize the font size. When there's a sparkline there's plenty of room to bring in bigger digits. Could also allow users to add emphasis on some of the columns.
What is this? Looks like old commits from last year.
LGTM once the tests pass
@williaster @michellethomas
Are you using it on python 2? I suggest you migrate to python 3.
Python 3.4. Therefore I am fairly surprised as well...

This is CH response, you're trying to connect to clickhouse with user "test"
1. Check if this user exists in CH with password you've provided, and login access in CH is opened from IP you're trying to connect
2. Try to check that option in superset, when creating datasource "Impersonate the logged on user" isn't marked - it shouldn't be selected
The errors suggests that gunicorn does not like non-ascii chars in http headers. I think it's right and so we have to be more careful on what we are sending.

I also had similar problem. Issue was in old version of mysqlclient (1.3.2 instead of 1.3.12)
Make sure that all your database drivers are Python3 compliant.

Hope it helps.
That's a generic error message, without a stack trace we have no idea where it's coming from... Closing.

Are you sure your worker is pointing to the same metadata database? My guess is that your `superset_config` is different or not in effect (not in your PYTHONPATH perhaps) on your worker.

For this to work the web server and worker need to share the same metadata db.

There are a few challenges around this but it's on the roadmap. While the "Filter Box" slice type is useful, it's pretty limited in what it can do and I've been thinking it needs to be re-written in a more generic way. Currently for instance it does not allow for per-dimension-configuration (all dims are based off the same metric for instance and sorted based on the same rule).

We need a more generic "dashboard controller" dashboard section or viz type. Folks at Airbnb are re-designing the whole dashboard app so that it can have nested "scoped" sections, tabs, filters that apply only to sub sections, ... Many of these dashboard components shouldn't be modeled as a visualization types but instead as dashboard primitives. 

Note that dashboard-level controls are in scope I think, meaning bringing a "GroupBy" control (or any other control) to a dashboard section can affect many charts.

One challenge specific to this is the fact that controls are pretty heterogenous across viz types and we may need metadata that binds some of the most similar and comonly used controls. 

@williaster can you share your mocks?

I'm using the same superset config. I'm using sqlite as the db. 
I tested the config. Its the custom config I'm using.
How do I check if I'm using the same metadata db?
Well SQLLite won't work here as it's a poor man's database that's on the local file system. It has limited support for concurrency, you should use MySQL or Postgres.
Which version of Druid?
I also prefer tagging over groups

Few notes:
* tags should be create as a many to many relationship in the db, eventually can be reused to tag slices using the same tag namespace but that lower pri
* most of the UI stuff (filtered Dashboard list view, tag creation / association) can be done automagically in FAB by just setting the model and modelviews properly
* tags should be surfaced right of the dashboard title ("label-default"), with click navigation taking users to filtered dashboard list

Some thoughts on your second item:

If a slice is already associated to more than one dashboard, what is the user's expectation?

* only take into account the dashboards that he owns?
* ask which one to forward to?
* take the most recently changed one?
* or the one which the user last accessed, and which maybe led him to editing this slice?
Looks like unidecode or Unicode data might be helpful here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/517923/what-is-the-best-way-to-remove-accents-in-a-python-unicode-string/517974
LGTM
lgtm
@mistercrunch Thank you!

Howdy! Similar to the original reporter, I want to embed dashboards into a separate product.

How do I, as @mistercrunch suggested, "render the dashboard into an <iframe>" while avoiding the need to login to Superset?

Note: I can't use public dashboards here, as I'll need to manage the permissions for each different user of the product (so they can't see each others' data). So my backend will be managing Superset users, and I need iframes which are somehow "pre-logged into" the relevant user, similar to the [private URL/permalinks feature of Zoho](https://www.zoho.com/reports/help/publishing/embedding-in-web-pages-reports.html#e5).

Should this be merged with #1846 ?
I believe a draft of the admin tutorial with the working images is located [Here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1etmwuGWziWTKM4a54f6EA7vm74wDRwulW7nX4KTtKK4/edit)
Just seeing if you tested this with a time series chart too? That too was still broken after #3920.
Yes I checked it with that. The test case is the one where `timeseries_limit` is specified

I just tested this and it fails for the time series charts. I'm using a column in the group by having the same setup as I reported in #3943. Using a data table view works fine.

Hi Any update on this ? facing the same issue with postgres DB

Looks like it's an issue with `_add_filter_from_pre_query_data`, which doesn't properly handle dimensions specs (and is called for timeseries). I think that's a bit outside the scope of this fix. And I'm not really familiar with PyDruid.
I believe Eli is working on the mocks, will post or get him to once they're done (likely next week)
LGTM

I'm now in an environment where we use both Postgres and Redshift and everything is working fine. Last comments on this ticket are a year old and I think these issues have been resolved since.

Are you sure you're not getting some the database and schema names confused or something like that?

I like this idea! Though I think we probably want to support Druid SQL in general first. 

I spoke with folks from the Druid core team at a meetup Tuesday and they said that we should move Superset to use SQL against Druid in the near future. As we get Druid setup at Lyft we may write the SQLAlchemy and DBAPI driver required for that.
@williaster @graceguo-supercat I'd love a review on this pretty plz

those rst files are the source code that power this:
http://superset.apache.org/tutorial.html

It just happens that github tries to generate it.

There's most likely a way to set up the rst so that both the html and the rst files on github look good
@diego-d5000 you may want to use `&standalone=true` if there's already a `?` in the url
@bilalakil you should open a new issue for this as it's a different subject altogether, closing this one as I just tested and standalone works just fine

Maybe a zombie web worker pointing to another database? Does query with id 179 exist on the db? If not then it seems to point to a faulty web worker, if it is there then it seems to point to a faulty worker.

I thought about this as I was writing the issue...

From my experience it's pretty rare that one slice is in two dashboards, but we should still handle it. I'd say prefer one that the user owns, otherwise pick one at random. Could also include the title in the button [Save & go to "My Dashboard"]

I checked the database, query id 179 exist. In the worker, i suspected it is connecting to local postgres DB, so i stopped the postgress DB in worker, to check whether it connects to the main central DB running in web server. I get the below error now

```
SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = 'postgresql://user:password@<webserver_ip>:5432/myapp'
```
 And also connection between the two servers works fine.
It took ~1hr but it showed up after that.

Thanks @Mogball for taking a look at this. I just applied the patch and tested it out. I now get "No data was returned" instead of the exception. If I click on View Query it only shows the first phase of the query and not the second. When I run that query directly against druid, I get results for the topN.

@ghulands Thanks for letting me know. I removed a condition thinking Druid handles single `"dimension"` specs but I think I was right before to check if a single dimension is a spec. Checkout the change and let me know if it's working.
Still the same behavior observed with updated patch.
Could you post logs from running these queries? (And it's still just doing 1 phase right?)

Yes, it's still only running 1 phase. I edited the log to reduce the map size of the dimension.
